author: Meteorologist Ryan Munn
title: Maine rivers face increased flooding risk this week as ice jams are possible - NewsBreak
text:
WGME
website
Maine
Maine rivers face increased flooding risk this week as ice jams are possible
By Meteorologist Ryan Munn,
3 hours agoWESTBROOK (WGME) -- The rain is falling and warmer temperatures have arrived, which means an increased risk for ice jams and flooding along Maine’s rivers. “They form during the freeze-thaw cycles that you’ll find in late winter, early spring when the temperatures are fluctuating. You’ll see those pieces of floating ice carried down the river and they can build up at any obstruction,” MEMA Public Outreach Specialist Spencer Roberts said.
1
